text:
Question 168) The Human Development Index (HDI) is a measure used to classify countries by their degree of development. For its calculation, life expectancy is taken into account at birth, time of education and per capita income, among others. The lowest value of this index is zero and the highest is one. Five countries were evaluated and obtained the following human development rates: the first country received a value X, the second X, the third x 1 3, the fourth X 2 and the last X 3. None of these countries has zeroed or reached the maximum index .
Which of these countries got the largest HDI?
A) The first.
B) the second.
C) the third.
From room.
E) the fifth.
